content.question: The preceding figure shows the graph of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math>. If <math alttext="g of x equals, the integral from 1 to x, of, f of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>g</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mi>x</mi></msubsup><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math>, which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The line begins below the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, and moves horizontally to the right. It crosses the y axis just below the origin and ends below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis.

The figure shows the graph of two line segments in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The first line segment begins above the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, and moves horizontally to the right. It crosses the y axis above the origin and ends above 1 on the x axis at an open circle. The second line segment begins below 1 on the x axis at an open circle, moves horizontally to the right, and ends below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis.

The figure shows the graph of a parabola in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The parabola opens upward and the vertex lies on the x axis at 1. The parabola begins high above the x axis, far to the right of the y axis, and moves gradually downward and to the right crossing the y axis just above the origin. It reaches the vertex and then moves gradually upward and to the right, ending high above the x axis, far to the right of the y axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins high above the x axis, to the left of the y axis, moves downward and to the right, and crosses the y axis just above the origin. It continues gradually downward and to the right at first, crosses the x axis at 1, and then moves more steeply downward and to the right until it ends far below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The line begins below the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, and moves horizontally to the right. It crosses the y axis just below the origin and ends below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis.

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
